meanings.definition: The ability to conceive children or produce offspring.
meanings.sent1: Her fertility allowed her to have twins.
meanings.sent2: The farmer's fields showed great fertility this year.
meanings.sent3: The rabbit's fertility was so high, it seemed like they were having a party!
meanings.sent4: The land's fertility was a treasure trove of life waiting to bloom.
meanings.sent5: The fertility of the soil was evident in the lush greenery that surrounded the farm.

meanings.definition: The quality of being fertile or productive.
meanings.sent1: The artist's creativity and fertility of ideas amazed everyone.
meanings.sent2: The fertility of the hen's eggs was impressive.
meanings.sent3: The garden's fertility was so good, even the rocks seemed to sprout flowers!
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a garden of endless fertility, yielding new thoughts every day.
meanings.sent5: The writer's imagination knew no bounds, a true testament to the fertility of his mind.

meanings.definition: The state of being fertile or capable of reproduction.
meanings.sent1: The doctor confirmed her fertility after the tests.
meanings.sent2: The lioness's fertility was crucial for the survival of the pride.
meanings.sent3: The tree's fertility was so high, it seemed to be competing with the birds for offspring!
meanings.sent4: In the forest, the cycle of life depended on the fertility of each species.
meanings.sent5: The queen bee's fertility was unmatched, ensuring the hive's prosperity.
